Sorcerer changes (They don't seem all that reliable, but here they are)Path of the True FlameThe Path of the True Flame can be chosen at character creation by sorcerers. Followers of the Path of the True Flame get unlimited spells per day, but can cast only evocation spells. This limitation includes spells cast from scrolls, wands, and items like potions;Weave MasterWeave Master can be chosen at character creation by sorcerers. Weave masters get unlimited spells per day, but they trigger a cooldown period whenever they cast a spell above the first circle in which they cannot cast any spell. The Cooldown formula is: (Spell level -1)*6 seconds.Note that while the cooldown is still in effect, Weave Masters may still cast spells from other sources, like wands, scrolls and potions.The cooldown timer is based on the spell slot, and not the actual spell itself. So spells modified with metamagic, except Quicken Spell, will increase the cooldown accordingly.
  • The metamagic Feat "Quicken Spell", when used to cast a spell, will reduce the effective level of the spell by 1 when calculating cooldowns.
  • Using Quicken Spell once you have autoquicken will not decrease the cooldown further.
  • Auto Quicken I: Spells of level 2-3 no longer have cooldown.

Any help is appreciated thanks!

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Prestige classes like BG can have some stiff prereqs.  For BG, you'll need to meet the BAB+6 (that takes at least 12 levels of sorc), a cross-class to Hide skill (needs 10 skill points or min of sorc 7) and the Cleave feat.  So, though BG is certainly viable, you'll be investing in areas which you may never get a return on your investment.  Let's examine pally now...

No prereqs other than alignment (but again, check with the server rules in regards to custom changes). 

Both classes are able to elect Divine Shield/Divine Might with 3 class levels.  Both gain the boost to saves at their first level.

So your roleplay preference will have an associated cost in either case.  For the earliest divine advantage, pally is the choice, which is why most exalted sorceresses go that route.

For a late skill dump (this would be more for PvP than PvM), you'd need a late pally level.  Something like sorc17/pal3 pre-epic gets you Divine Shield, then overall sorc 26/pal4 for that late Taunt and Discipline dump.

BG works the same way but must wait until at least after src 12 before getting the AC boost of the CHA shield.  With BG you need not be concerned with allocating any points to WIS since they have no spellcasting potential.

On a Level 30 cap server, trying to focus in more than one school is futile IMO.  You'll need to pump your primary ability as high as possible and those additional epic foci will get in the way.  Your ultimate power lies in your charisma and there's no way around it.  A wizard can get away with focusing in multiple schools during pre-epic with the extra feats, but is subject to the same conflict in epic levels as a sorc is (needs ultra INT instead of ultra CHA).

From what I've read about Arelith (and it hasn't been much, granted), it may be possible for you to play a fallen paladin, one that does not adhere to the strict rules of the order because they became disillusioned along the way but still retained their paladin training while interfacing with the outside world.  Check into it.  There may be more possibilities than at first glance. It would be ideal to use some sort of neutral alignment to be immune to smites.  Dunno, though. Time for some research on your part.

edit: Bah!  I keep forgetting this is a Level 30 build.  Pally spellcasting has no relevance at all with Pally 4 so removed those comments.

Welcome to the guild Xcalivurs!

As for the Exalted Sorceress, it is a lvl 40 build with 1 level of Paladin, one level of monk and 38 levels of Sorcerer. That means that there is no Divine shield.
What one gets from Paladin is heavy armor and shield, a discipline dump and a huge bonus to saves. You also get martial weapons if you fancy that. Monk gives evasion, tumble and another discipline dump. You also get access to class specific gear.
An important part of the build idea is to cast in full armor and shield. For that you have still spell and the 3 auto-still feats. You also have the option to cast with +10AC from improved expertise. You also get epic necro focus, extend,empower and maximise.
The build also has improved combat casting, EMA and EW.
It is possible to cram most of that into a lvl 30 build, but I dont know if it is possible under the Arelith rules.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Sure.  Human is a more conducive choice especially with the overhead that the BG prereqs cause. With 26 levels of sorc on a 30 cap server, I wouldn't expect penetration to become an issue.  Your main problem will be AC.  That's the reason for Expertise.  Instead, there are more useful alternatives for that extra feat.  Extend Spell (for Haste, damage shields, mantles, Grtr Sanctuary), Improved Expertise (even more help with the AC problem) or Blind Fight (to help avoid the additional threat coming from concealed attacks).  All those I would expect to be more influential than a +2 to beat SR.

In the same respect (AC), the +3 Tumble AC will help most.  That intrinsic AC 12 really scares me, hence the Divine Shield, but you won't get the feat until level 15 and won't get full benefit until your CHA bumps begin to add up.  Heal skill makes heal kits better.  IMO it's better to avoid getting your concentration tested in the first place and wasting a round to use a kit.

And don't forget the extra 30 HP.  That will break the 200 HP barrier and with Empowered Endure can be boosted up to 320 HP (you'll probably want to focus on Striding Boots and other such CON-boost item props to, ideally, cap your CON) and the +1 Fort save (they all mount up).

With successful taunts, PvP vs mages will give you a 30% casting advantage and also boost your polymorph AB vs. spell immunes (yes, all the polymorphs can use skills like Taunt, Open Locks, Disable traps, etc).

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Bard3 will net +3 Tumble over the cross-class's +3, easily dispelled spells that all are available to sorc, UMD by sacrificing some other skill and a minor song that won't help AC until Bard 11.  The cost is a sorc bonus feat and sorc buffs that are dispellable by Greater Dispelling (src24, minimum to avoid that).  There are always consequences.  I was assuming that, like most of the arcanists on Arelith, you'll appreciate the availability of two epic spells (apparently epic spells have been fortified on that server).  Too bad about the 3-level minimum, though.  A src26/bg3/brd1 would have indeed been a superior mix.

Best case scenario figuring only non-magical gear results in: AC 12 + 3dex (emp cat) + 11divshld (w/emp eagle pre-buff) +2mage arm (deflect/natural overwritten) + 4shield (defl) +4haste +5shad arm (nat) = 41, 46 in Expertise Mode and 51 in ImpExpertise mode.  Those figures assume mundane gear and no gifts or other increases to the primary ability or DEX.  As you can see, the Divine Shield boost makes a world of difference and cannot be dispelled by any means including a Mord.

Take heed that PvP mages (min wiz13/src14) will all be immune to necromancy spells by virtue of Shadow Shield (that's without a PW-specific nerf, of course) unless you are able to dispel it.

edit: oops!  I forgot to include the cross-class Tumble AC should you decide to go human or increase the INT by 2 via gift.  In either of those two cases, add another 3 AC to get 44/49/54 depending on the mode.
